name: Alexandre Sepulveda De Dietrich
title: Data Scientist and Business Analytics (MSBA candidate)
about: I build reliable analytics and machine learning systems that help teams make confident decisions. My work spans anomaly detection, time-series analysis, and data quality pipelines across finance, commercial strategy, and research labs.

experience.role: Data Scientist Intern, Advanced Analytics and Data Science
highlights: Led development of CRAFT, an outlier detection system analyzing 30M+ accounting entries for finance teams.
Built custom anomaly detection pipelines for mixed data and tracked experiments with MLflow.
Deployed models via Azure ML and delivered near-production data quality monitoring.

experience.role: Data Analyst Intern, Commercial Excellence Europe
highlights: Analyzed commercial performance across 6 countries and 60 resellers to surface ROI levers.
Built 5 dynamic dashboards standardizing KPIs for negotiation teams.
Enabled data-driven account strategy with consistent GP, NSV, and volume reporting.

experience.role: Research Project, Sensor Fusion Vehicle Tracking
highlights: Built a camera and ranging sensor fusion pipeline using optimal transport.
Reached about 20 cm positional accuracy within a 3 m by 2 m test area.
Coordinated with a 3-person team and presented findings to stakeholders.

details: Coursework: AI Engineering, Marketing Analytics, Business Analytics, Data Analytics, Probability Statistics and Simulation

education.degree: Diplome d'Ingenieur (MEng) in Mathematics and Data Science
details: Coursework: Algorithms and Networks, Machine Learning, HPC and Cloud Computing, Signal Processing, Game Theory

education.degree: Intensive Preparatory Course in Physics and Engineering
details: Ranked top 2 percent of national competitive entrance exams
Two to three year intensive program preparing for France's top engineering schools

projects.title: HelpfulLens
projects.summary: Accessibility-oriented concept exploring how to surface helpful context quickly.
highlights: Defined the problem space and key user scenarios.
Sketched a lightweight product workflow and UI concept.
Documented next steps for feasibility testing.

projects.title: FinAnts
projects.summary: Personal finance analytics prototype focused on clarity and decision support.
highlights: Structured the data model for transactions and categories.
Designed key metrics for cash flow and savings trends.
Outlined a roadmap for predictive insights.

projects.title: Zeit
projects.summary: Time-focused productivity concept with a data-first approach.
highlights: Mapped core user journeys and friction points.
Prototyped a weekly review and planning flow.
Identified opportunities for behavioral analytics.

projects.title: Resume Readiness Intelligence Engine
projects.summary: Tooling concept to assess resume readiness with structured criteria.
highlights: Defined a rubric to score clarity, impact, and relevance.
Designed outputs to guide targeted improvements.
Planned integration points for automated feedback.

projects.title: Forvia Camera-Radar Fusion Prototype
projects.summary: Sensor fusion pipeline for vehicle tracking using camera and ranging data.
highlights: Implemented optimal transport for multi-sensor alignment.
Reached about 20 cm positional accuracy in a small test area.
Coordinated a 3-person team and shared results with stakeholders.

projects.title: Museum Companion App with Computer Vision
projects.summary: Concept app to support museum visitors with vision-based discovery.
highlights: Outlined feature flows for object recognition and guidance.
Drafted UX for personalized content delivery.
Identified data and model requirements for next steps.

projects.title: CHANEL Europe Analytics Pipeline
projects.summary: Accounting data quality and anomaly detection pipeline for finance teams.
highlights: Analyzed 30M+ accounting entries for anomalies and outliers.
Built mixed-data detection pipelines and tracked experiments with MLflow.
Deployed models through Azure ML for near-production monitoring.
